brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts physical characteristics of various forms of Ethernet and wireless media.

Ethernet Technologies and Media Used:
Ethernet Standard: 10 Base-T
Media: EIA/TIA Category 3, 4, 5 UTP - four pair
Max segment length: 100 meters or 328 feet
Topology: Star
Connector: I S O 8877 (RJ-45)

Ethernet Standard: 100 Base-TX
Media: EIA/TIA Category 5 UTP - two pair
Max segment length: 100 meters or 328 feet
Topology: Star
Connector: I S O 8877 (RJ-45)

Ethernet Standard: 100 Base-FX
Media: 50/62.5 multi-mode fiber
Max segment length: 2 kilometers or 6,562 feet
Topology: Star
Connector: Various

Ethernet Standard: 1000 Base-CX
Media: STP
Max segment length: 25 meters or 82 feet
Topology: Star
Connector: I S O 8877 (RJ-45)

Ethernet Standard: 1000 Base-T
Media: EIA/TIA Category 5 (or greater) UTP - four pair
Max segment length: 100 meters or 328 feet
Topology: Star
Connector: Various

Ethernet Standard: 1000 Base-SX
Media: 50/62.5 multi-mode fiber
Max segment length: Up to 550 meters (1,804 feet) depending on fiber used
Topology: Star
Connector: Various

Ethernet Standard: 1000 Base-LX
Media: 50/62.5 multi-mode fiber (MMF) or 9 micron single mode fiber (SMF)
Max segment length: 550 meters (MMF) or 10 kilometers (SMF)
Topology: Star
Connector: Various

Ethernet Standard: 1000 Base-ZX
Media: 9 micron single mode fiber
Max segment length: Approximately 70 kilometers
Topology: Star
Connector: Various

Ethernet Standard: 10G Base-ZR
Media: 9 micron single mode fiber
Max segment length: Up to 80 kilometers
Topology: Star
Connector: Various

Wireless media:
Standard: Bluetooth 8 0 2 dot 15
Speed: <1 Mbps
Range: Short
Applications: Peer-to-peer device-to-device

Standard: 8 0 2 dot 11(a, b, g, n), HiperLAN 2
Speed: 1 to 54+ Mbps
Range: Medium
Applications: Enterprise networks

Standard: MMDS, LMDS
Speed: 22 Mbps+
Range: Medium-long
Applications: Fixed, last mile access

Standard: GSM, GPRS, CDMA, 2.5 to 3G
Speed: 10 to 384 Kbps
Range: Long
Applications: PDA's, mobile phones, cellular access
